caption: Excellent, small museum! Around 1 hour I think is enough, but totally worth the price. We were incredibly lucky to visit when the Stephen Jones exhibition was on, which was brilliant. A huge collection of his work, expertly laid out and with music to boot.  The history of fashion is also good - nothing that will blow your mind but good pieces and plenty to look at. Definitely recommend this for any fashion minded visitors to Paris, and far surpasses the meagre and disappointing YSL museum
I went to see the temporary exhibition currently on Display Stephen Jone It was a really nice collection of hats and dresses. The permanent collection was also quite adorable

If you are interested in fashion, the history of the fashion please go and enjoy. However please be ready for the judgemental looks, so please dress-up üòâ Please buy your ticket in advance online - so simple and you can save some time.

Relatively small, but informative exhibition (made in collaboration with Chanel) about history of fashion, evolution of sportswear in particular and multiple garments that represent each of its phases. Translation to English available, and there is a fashion-dedicated bookshop at the exit.
Small but wonderfully ornate building housing articles of fine art and textiles on temporary exhibitions.
The exhibition on Stephen Jones is a gorgeous delight!!

I really loved this museum. It‚Äôs not very big so ban be covered in an hour or so. The historical clothing is really interesting to see, although I was slightly confused by the layout of the time periods even following the map. It is downstairs underground but there is a lift. The information was all in french and English. There are free lockers to store your belongings and a small gift shop. The staff I encountered were all friendly. There is a pretty little park outside. I visited on a Wednesday in summer and there wasn‚Äôt a queue

Very nice museum! I went to the Alaia exposition and the dresses and stories for each creator were super nice!  Only thing I have to say is that yes, it is quite tiny. I do wish they would display more artworks from the collections.

The location seems to be amazing and the expositions, all related to fashion and costumes, are interesting. But the hall dedicated to the expos is quite small and it's not possible to visit the palace or its garden. So in the end I think it doesn't worth the ticket price.
Beautiful exhibition space. I saw Paolo Roversi  exhibit and it was Gorgeous.People were very friendly and helpful when I went even though I didn‚Äôt speak French.
Fav museum to visit when I‚Äôm around. Always quality exhibitions and well curated. 5/5
For fashion aficionados; a great place to see original garments up close.  There are themed exhibits at this museum. The grounds are lovely to visit as well.

A museum dedicated to fashion is very fitting for a place like Paris. There were exhibits dating from the 17th to the 20th centuries, all perfectly preserved. The exhibits show how fashion trend has followed societal growth and changes over time with an emphasis on women's roles. I only wish there had been a bit more about men's styles.

Never been disappointed with this museum always focusing on amazing textile and fashion designers. Always feel I want to wear these wonderful creations. It's also next to a beautiful park where you can have a picnic though now the entrance next to the museum is closed for security reasons.
Everything was so interesting and beautiful, I wanted it to go on and on.

This is a museum that worth a visit. It is located in a wonderful 18th century mansion. If you like exhibitions related to fashion you will like the interior as well. In any case in its basement there is a permanent display of costumes, shoes since 17th century

Same comment as from many others: "The Palais Galliera preserves some of the richest collections in the world. Estimated today at nearly 200,000 works." doesn't quite tell that there are only ~30 dresses to be seen. Those few were nice though.
Went by chance to see the fashion exhibition (superb brief moment), but the palace itself was memorable. Building recently renovated, it was simply beautiful.

I always love the fashion exhibitions here.  The Frida Kahlo exhibition began in an extremely crowded narrow curving hallway.  Having claustrophobia and agoraphobia, I had to aggressively pardon my way through to a more open room.  The rest of the exhibition was terrific.

Beautiful museum, beautiful clothes (both historical and haute couture) but the new corridor downstairs is really too small for a public exhibition space. Also not enough lockers (upstairs and downstairs).
peaceful place with a great expo about movement and clothes!

The history of fashion and style museum. I would‚Äôve not come here if it were not my wife‚Äôs cousin‚Äôs daughter wanted to see it. I did find it interesting after a few minutes. Explaining the evolution of fashion not only for women, but for men as well. My favorite and most interesting part was the evolution of beachwear. Never realized that prior to the 1800s it was not common to go to the beach and to go swimming in the beach.
Amazing and beautiful gallery You can walk this in about 1 hour. Incredible information and display. The customer service was Incredible.  Perfect rainy day activity.

Fantastic little museum of French fashions. Not too large. They had an incredible special exhibit of couture dresses (the collection of Azzedine Ala√Øa), though the permanent exhibit alone perhaps isn‚Äôt worth the admission.

Slightly disappointed. The Paolo Roversi exhibition was excellent but I was hoping to see some of the collections, I guess with limited space they can only show so much. On the plus side the gardens are a great place to pass time watching the world go by - every time I've been there there has been a fashion photoshoot going on.
Stunning place and exhibit  Excellent customer service
1997 Fashion Big Band exhibition very recommended, until July 16 Downstairs there's collection of History if fashion 18th to 19th century
Medium size fashion museum with rotating exhibit themes and a permanent collection on the history of fashion (fascinating).
A total waste of time and money - only half of the exhibition available to see for 100% of the ticket price. Very little to see. unpleasant staff at the reception.
Great exhibition. The place was really clean, had easy access and a nice flow within the building.
When I come here, they said only has one exhibition available, and this exhibition was really really small, like 20 min u could see them all. Not worth it this time‚Ä¶.. so regret that come here
Stunning museum, the vogue exhibition was very well done. Highly recommend. Prebooking tickets online is recommended, tickets cost around 0-16‚Ç¨ depending on ur age, work, and EU citizenship.
I was hoping to see the Channel exhibit but no. It was not there even though the website indicated it was. I enjoyed the exhibit about fashion and women's sports.
Went for the Azzedine Alaia exhibition. Very nice, some really cool pieces

Saw both exhibitions including Love Brings Love). Was my 3rd visit.  Their main collection is downstairs (some parts of the collection rotate so you do see new things on revisits).  The temporary exhibition is upstairs. Your ticket gives you access to both. Item labels are in French and English.  You can also become a member for unlimited access to this and other museums.  There is a free app that give English and French audio and text/transcript for select pieces in their collection. It‚Äôs interesting and worth listening to.  The current Love Brings Love exhibition also has QR codes for every outfit to explore further.  It‚Äôs a beautiful building but you don‚Äôt see much of it from the inside as the rooms are all dark - instead enjoy the gardens and courtyard.  It‚Äôs also located next to Palais Tokyo and Mus√©e d‚Äôart Moderne (MAM).
Amazing museum, really well put together. The  exhibition for 100 years of Vogue Paris is really worth a visit.

This is one of cleanest public buildings I have ever been in, it was so pleasant. We went as a family of 6 ranging from 8-68 in age.  We enjoyed the display on the entrance level very much and loved looking at all of the designer clothing. It was a very artistic display and the building itself is stunning.  The basement level displays were a little trickier to navigate, a route would have made it flow a little better but we found the displays interesting and informative.  The children weren‚Äôt so impressed as the grown ups but as an impromptu visit on the day we left to return home, it worked well.
That‚Äôs really great exhibition ! I am so happy that I d visited it before second lockdown . Still keeping amazing memories
